programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: The abduction and brutal torture of two college football stars puts the team on the trail of a violent drug dealer looking to extract vengeance for a drug deal gone bad.

programme.title: The Restoration Road
programme.desc: As we travel this side of life, none of us arrives anywhere by accident. We choose, think, pray, and feel our way down a road of desires and intentional acts that bring us to our destination. We program our internal GPS to guide us to one of two places: destruction or restoration. Which direction are you heading? For seventeen years, host, Mitch Kruse was owner, CEO, and auctioneer for Kruse International, the worlds largest collector car sales organisation. Today, Mitch writes and speaks to a wide array of audiences and on The Restoration Road offers sound biblical teaching exploring wisdom, leadership and restoration. Is there anything in your life that needs restoration? Like a classic car that needs restoration, each one of us must surrender our old wreck of a life to the Restorer who desires to return us to His original design.

programme.title: Bible Discovery TV
programme.desc: Hosted by the Hembree family, Bible Discovery TV is a thirty-minute daily devotional show where Rod, Janice, Ryan and Corie walk you through the Word in a way that will forever change how you read, learn and experience the Bible.

programme.title: Answers with Bayless Conley
programme.sub-title: Why Haven_t My Prayers Been Answered? Part 1
programme.desc: It is one of lifes pressing questions: Why do prayers sometimes seem to go unanswered? Pastor Bayless begins to unpack the answer in part one of his message, Why Havent My Prayers Been Answered? Dive in and discover what the different types of prayer are, and why it is important to pray with holy hands, free from unresolved anger, doubt, and bitterness. Discover how you can unlock the power of persistent, faith-filled prayer in this encouraging message!

programme.title: Katherine Ruonala Ministries
programme.desc: Katherine Ruonala shares a practical message of love and hope to the nations. Reaching across denominational walls, her ministry is used to spread the fires of revival and ignite a fresh passion in the hearts of believers to go deeper in their relationship with God. Katherine carries a strong prophetic and miracle anointing with many experiencing instant healing in her meetings.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: The 700 Club is a daily magazine programme with news, interviews, lifestyle features and true-life stories from a Christian perspective. including powerful and dramatic testimonies of God touching peoples lives. Where does the name The 700 Club come from? When the show started to air more than 50 years ago, founder and host Pat Robertson needed to have just 700 Partners to donate $5 a month to make the programme possible. Those original 700 supporters couldnt have imagined they would start a TV show that is now seen every day in over 200 countries, impacting the nations with the Gospel of Jesus Christ!

programme.title: Joyce Meyer: Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.desc: With her no nonsense preaching Joyce Meyer shares practical teaching about living life as a Christian. In an encouraging and supportive way, hear real stories that will challenge you to be the best that you can be. Joyce Meyer is one of the worlds leading practical Bible teachers. A New York Times bestselling author, her books have helped millions of people find hope and restoration through Jesus Christ. In this series you will see her powerful preaching from her home church, as well as the crusades around the world, and intriguing interviews with a variety of guests. Be inspired and encouraged this week, with Joyce Meyer on Enjoying Everyday Life.

programme.title: In Touch
programme.sub-title: The Promise To Heal/A Life of Service
programme.desc: The In Touch program reaches the world with the Gospel with messages that tackle such issues as parenting, finances, personal crises, emotions, and relationships. Dr. Stanley fervently believes the Bible to be the inerrant Word of God, a belief strongly reflected in his teaching. Dr Charles Stanley is the author of more than 50 books.

programme.title: Bottled With Love
programme.desc: Abbey, a driven executive from Boston, makes a bold move in a rare moment of vulnerability, pouring her heart into an anonymous letter about her longing for love. Sealing it in a bottle, she tosses it into Boston Harbour, never expecting it to be found. Months later, the bottle washes ashore and is discovered by Nick, the son of the CEO of Everett Valley Farms - the very company where Abbey is about to close the biggest deal of her career. When Nick returns home to help with his fathers business, he decides to reach out to the mystery woman using the email address in the letter. Unaware of each others true identities, Abbey and Nick form a growing connection online. However, in person, they find themselves clashing as theyre forced to work together on a major project. As their relationship deepens, both online and offline, theyre faced with the challenge of reconciling their professional differences with their blossoming romance.

programme.title: Jeni: Seeking the Extraordinary
programme.desc: Jeni is back on the road, visiting the amazing state of Oregon in the USA. Close friend, Casey Cole, joins her in this exciting series. Together, they go fly fishing, crabbing, white water rafting, and zip lining. During their adventure, Jeni and Casey take you to the picturesque Cannon Beach and experience the fun of an exciting rodeo. Lots of laughter and adventure, times of sharing their hearts about spiritual matters, and plenty of the extraordinary.

programme.title: Holy Moly
programme.desc: Holy Moly turns the Bible into a living, breathing colouring book that will delight children of all ages. Eyes will be fixed on the screen, observing how God is at work in the story when colour is introduced to an otherwise black-and-white world. Rather than dialogue, the series focuses on the Biblical characters actions and emotions to help audiences of any language or background immediately relate to and remember these enriching stories.

programme.title: The Blello Show
programme.desc: Join Kyle, Lyds, Extra Bear, and Stu as they share with you some cool vids, catchy catch phrases crazy challenges, things you can do in 3 minutes, and other random stuff to make your life awesome. Its the Blello Show! Lets go!

programme.title: Elevation Experience
programme.desc: The Elevation Experience with Pastor Steven Furtick features inspirational and challenging messages from Pastor Steven as well as original worship music from Elevation Church in Charlotte, North Carolina.

programme.title: A Moment in History
programme.desc: Join host Seth Udinski as he explores the most pivotal moments in history and the Bible, providing insight into the events that have shaped our world.

programme.title: Faith Runs Deep
programme.desc: Faith Runs Deep is the new series from the producers of the award-winning program, Jesus the Game Changer. Host Karl Faase travels around Australia, discovering the rich and inspiring history of faith Down Under, demonstrating the depth of influence of the Gospel message on Australia. The team drives from the cities to the outback in an iconic Holden ute, unearthing stories from history and today of people whose lives have been changed by Jesus, and who have deeply influenced this nation. Each episode covers a different theme or time in Australias history. Hear from historians and academics; remarkable Australians of faith; and Karl and Jane Faase about their own journey of faith.

programme.title: Drive Thru History: Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: Hosted by historian and filmmaker Dave Stotts, Drive Thru History: Ends of the Earth takes viewers on a 19-episode, global trek to every corner of the earth, to show how God has used ordinary people throughout history to take His saving grace to every nation and people.

programme.title: This Changed Everything
programme.desc: This Changed Everything: 500 Years of the Reformation celebrates the fruits of the Reformation while exploring difficult questions about the cost of division: Could schism have been avoided? Is there hope for reunification? What did Jesus really mean when He prayed for His followers to be one? In this visually rich, three-part documentary series hosted by actor David Suchet, leading church historians share fascinating insights and pose vital questions about unity, truth, and the future of the Christian church.

programme.title: Outback Rider
programme.desc: This is the record of a road trip with a difference - taking a Harley where it was never designed to go. Country music artist Steve Grace had a dream of riding his motorbike from Byron Bay to the Birdsville Hotel in remote Outback Queensland, along the way telling the stories of the hardworking people he encountered. Peter John directs the film, which shows Steve dealing with the extreme conditions of the 2015 drought that affected 80% of Queensland. It features breathtaking visuals, confronting interviews, and the severe and harsh conditions endured by those living on the land.

programme.title: Bible Land Passages
programme.sub-title: The Ministry of Jesus in Northern Israel
programme.desc: Bible Land Passages is designed help others better understand and appreciate the Bible. Read about places like Beersheba, Jericho, Jerusalem, Caesarea, and cities surrounding the Sea of Galilee, and discover that those places exist just as the Bible describes. Explore the lands of the Bible and uncover a window into the ancient past. Sift through the archaeological data, travel down the pathways of the Bible lands and traverse through the passages of its ancient cities, trade routes, and caves and understand and appreciate the challenges of life faced by Christian forbearers, and learn how God used the historical and geographic setting of the Bible lands to refine and develop their faith. Those same real places and same real settings - when examined in the modern era - can likewise become a passage for developing greater faith and devotion for God.

programme.title: The Incredible Journey
programme.desc: Gary Kent is the speaker for The Incredible Journey. He is an archaeologist who has excavated numerous sites throughout Israel and Jordan. He holds a BA in Theology, MA in Ancient History and Archaeology, and M in Divinity. As an internationally-acclaimed speaker and TV presenter, he has spoken and produced numerous documentaries on subjects including the Bible, Bible prophecy, world events, historical places and natural health. His passion is to share the good news of Jesus soon return.

programme.title: New Creation Church
programme.sub-title: Powerful Keys To Unlocking Gods Word Pt 3 of 4
programme.desc: Pastor Joseph Prince preaches dynamic messages centred on the pure gospel of the grace of God. His desire is to help believers understand grace and how greatly blessed, highly favoured and deeply loved they are by their heavenly Father.

programme.title: Joel Osteen
programme.desc: Direct from Houston, Texas, USA; join Joel and Victoria Osteen and the team from Lakewood Church, for this program of powerful music and empowering preaching. Experience from the weekend church service of Lakewood Church, the largest and fastest growing church in America that is inspiring millions of people around the world!

programme.title: The Way of the Master
programme.desc: Atheism cannot account for love. Without God, there can be no love.

programme.title: Joyce Meyer: Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.desc: With her no nonsense preaching Joyce Meyer shares practical teaching about living life as a Christian. In an encouraging and supportive way, hear real stories that will challenge you to be the best that you can be. Joyce Meyer is one of the worlds leading practical Bible teachers. A New York Times bestselling author, her books have helped millions of people find hope and restoration through Jesus Christ. In this series you will see her powerful preaching from her home church, as well as the crusades around the world, and intriguing interviews with a variety of guests. Be inspired and encouraged this week, with Joyce Meyer on Enjoying Everyday Life.

programme.title: Faith, Hope and Love
programme.desc: A couple of years after his wifes death, Jimmy Hope is struggling to move on with his life, at work and at home where hes trying to raise his two daughters alone. Faith Turley is recently divorced and doing her best to cope with the pain, but her troubles are compounded by the fact that her lifes dream, her dance studio, is in jeopardy of being shut down. To raise funds to save it, she enters a Pro and a Schmo dance contest and searches for a partner whos a non-professional. Jimmys younger daughter Demetra prays every night that her dad will be Faiths dance-contest partner because Our house needs a Mummy and our Daddy needs someone to love him. God hears her prayers, and Jimmy and Faith become dance partners. Over the next few months, on and off the dance floor, she teaches him to have hope, he helps restore her faith, and together they learn how to love again.

programme.title: Power for Living
programme.desc: Powerful words from Evangelist and Pastor Bill Newman.

programme.title: In Touch
programme.sub-title: The Promise To Heal/A Life of Service
programme.desc: The In Touch program reaches the world with the Gospel with messages that tackle such issues as parenting, finances, personal crises, emotions, and relationships. Dr. Stanley fervently believes the Bible to be the inerrant Word of God, a belief strongly reflected in his teaching. Dr Charles Stanley is the author of more than 50 books.

programme.title: David Pawson
programme.desc: Why was the Bible written? David Pawson explores scripture and discovers some hidden gems. David Pawson has a BSc in Agriculture and an MA in Theology from Cambridge. He was a Chaplain in the RAF for three years and went on to become Pastor of two Baptist Churches (Gold Hill in Buckinghamshire and the Millmead Centre in Guildford) where he maintained a strong Bible teaching ministry. Released for a wider ministry in 1979, he has since spoken in numerous towns and cities in the British Isles and also extensively overseas. He is the author of a number of books including Truth To Tell, Leadership is Male and The Normal Christian Birth.

programme.title: Flip that Romance
programme.desc: Jules and Lance once flipped a property together, but broke up in the process. Now each owns half a duplex and they start a flipping contest. Word of the duelling duplexes reaches the editor of Innovative Designs, who offers the winner a magazine spread. But when a storm kills the power, and Lance and Jules work by candlelight, their romance rekindles, only to get snuffed out when Lance hires a painting crew without consulting Jules. Confused, Lance gets fatherly advice, while Jules consults her mother about releasing resentments. While renovating their duplex, can these two flip their romance as well?

programme.title: New Creation Church
programme.sub-title: Powerful Keys To Unlocking Gods Word Pt 3 of 4
programme.desc: Pastor Joseph Prince preaches dynamic messages centred on the pure gospel of the grace of God. His desire is to help believers understand grace and how greatly blessed, highly favoured and deeply loved they are by their heavenly Father.

programme.title: Friends and Heroes
programme.desc: Friends and Heroes is an animated childrens adventure based in Ancient Egypt, Israel and Rome. The story follows two young friends Macky and Portia as they fight for justice against the Roman Empire.

programme.title: Night Owls and Early Birds
programme.desc: Night Owls and Early Birds is a new topical Bible study show from the creators of Owlegories. Join Hoot, Savannah, Screech, Charlie, and Steve as they take a deeper dive into the truths found in Gods Word.

programme.title: The Garden
programme.desc: Lenny Lion and Lucy Lamb are the caretakers for a magical garden where anything can grow. They work for The Boss (God) who gives them a new assignment to complete in every episode. Lenny is always happy and ready to take on the tasks the Boss gives him. However, much like Peter in the gospels, Lenny doesnt always think before he acts and usually needs help getting out of sticky situations. But hes teachable and willing to admit when hes wrong. His two best qualities are that he loves Jesus and is a true friend to Lucy. Lucy is sweet, smart and lamb-tastic! Shes kind-hearted, loving, and aims to support everyone she meets. Inside that happy demeanor is a strong-willed, adventurous, task-oriented gal who will take on any task handed to her. But, she still has a lot to learn when it comes to being an example for others. Her two best qualities are that she takes very good care of Lenny and points everyone to Jesus.

programme.title: Impact for Life
programme.desc: An inspirational program with principles for living, and life stories from everyday New Zealanders. Collated with a fresh and dynamic edge, Pastors Peter and Bev Mortlock share principles both from the platform, and on location. Impact for Life equips people to mature and grow into Christ-likeness while maximising their potential.

programme.title: Be Great. Do Good
programme.desc: In business you will need to be engaged with others to build success. Whether its suppliers, logistics, accountants, consultants, lawyers or something else, there will be times that you need help from others. The power of building strong business partnerships, beyond functionality, is so often overlooked. Leaving behind the opportunity for multiplying impact by working together for mutual benefit. Peter chats with Chris Chong from Misfit surf brand and learns how, by asking a potential global partner, how Misfit would be a good partner, a very different conversation and partnership developed. Peter and the team explore how openness and transparency around partnering and seeking the success of the partner empowers the greater success of each partner.

programme.title: Holy Rollin
programme.desc: Nick and Yvette Wynne take on the gruelling journey of riding around Australia on their matching 1200 Ducati motorbikes. Get a feel for the rugged sunburnt countryside and the people of the outback as these two motorcycle missionaries traverse 20 000 km in 3 months over 12 episodes.

programme.title: View and Chew
programme.desc: Mike explores the ups and downs of San Francisco on a classic cable car and digs into a crab feast fit for King Neptune.

programme.title: Centuries Collide
programme.sub-title: Martin Luther - The First Viral Post
programme.desc: Millions of things are posted everyday across countless platforms all in hopes of going VIRAL. In this episode learn about Martin Luther the man behind the worlds first VIRAL POST that brought about one of the biggest world-changing events of all time - The Protestant Reformation.

programme.title: Jentezen Franklin
programme.desc: New York Times bestselling author, Pastor Jentezen Franklin, brings practical meaning to spiritual truths found in Gods Word. Kingdom Connection is the teaching ministry of Free Chapel, a multi-campus church with a global ministry. Hear inspiration for change, healing, peace and joy through his affective communication connecting you to God, the church, and the world!

programme.title: David Jeremiah
programme.desc: Join us for the weekly church service conducted by David Jeremiah from San Diego, California, USA. Dedicated to providing sound, in-depth teaching of the Word of God verse by verse. Through his personable and expository teaching, pastor Dr David Jeremiah challenges viewers to take hold of the truths of Gods Word for themselves and to apply it to the daily circumstances in their own life, by presenting Gods truth in clear and practical applications.

programme.title: PowerPoint with Jack Graham
programme.desc: PowerPoint Ministries started as a vision of Dr Jack Graham and his wife, Deb, 20 years ago. They believed that the power of God was evident in their growing church and that His Gospel message should be spread beyond the walls of that church to the world at large. They put their faith into action and purchased airtime on the Trinity Broadcasting Network. PowerPoint Ministries was then officially launched in April 1994. Over the past 19 years, PowerPoint Ministries has grown to an expansive network of local, national, and international television and radio broadcasts. In fact, PowerPoint can be seen or heard by a potential audience of millions of television viewers and radio listeners across the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, South Africa, Iran, Russia, Israel and more. The Ministry has a vision to glorify God by introducing Jesus Christ as Lord to as many people as possible and to develop them in Christian living using the most effective means to impact the world, making an eternal difference in this generation.

programme.title: Joyce Meyer: Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.desc: With her no nonsense preaching Joyce Meyer shares practical teaching about living life as a Christian. In an encouraging and supportive way, hear real stories that will challenge you to be the best that you can be. Joyce Meyer is one of the worlds leading practical Bible teachers. A New York Times bestselling author, her books have helped millions of people find hope and restoration through Jesus Christ. In this series you will see her powerful preaching from her home church, as well as the crusades around the world, and intriguing interviews with a variety of guests. Be inspired and encouraged this week, with Joyce Meyer on Enjoying Everyday Life.

programme.title: Hour of Power
programme.desc: Since 1970 the Hour of Power has been reaching viewers from around the world. Originally founded by Dr Robert H Schuller, the program became the most-watched religious program in the world, reaching 17 million viewers. Now under the leadership of Bobby Schuller, Dr Schullers grandson. The congregation worships at Shepherds Grove Church in Garden Grove, CA. The program aims to provide spiritual principles and practices that can help people, as they become happy students of Jesus and live a life of meaning. To learn more about who they are in Christ through the process of formation, to belong to his family of believers and become a part of the community and to heal as they are loved and then love and help heal others through mission. Jesus Christ ushered in the Kingdom of God into our world through His death and resurrection. He invites everyone to be a part of this amazing movement by trusting and following Him. There is no fuller, richer life than the one that is lived in Christ.

programme.title: Drive Thru History: The Gospels
programme.desc: Dave Stotts takes us on his most exciting adventure yet as he tells the story of Jesus from the locations recorded in the Gospels of Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John. Dave travels to over 50 ancient sites in Israel to deliver the Gospels in a fresh and compelling way. As Dave uncovers the evidence for the truth of scripture, he encourages all of us to get excited about reading the Bible again!

programme.title: Faith Runs Deep
programme.desc: Faith Runs Deep is the new series from the producers of the award-winning program, Jesus the Game Changer. Host Karl Faase travels around Australia, discovering the rich and inspiring history of faith Down Under, demonstrating the depth of influence of the Gospel message on Australia. The team drives from the cities to the outback in an iconic Holden ute, unearthing stories from history and today of people whose lives have been changed by Jesus, and who have deeply influenced this nation. Each episode covers a different theme or time in Australias history. Hear from historians and academics; remarkable Australians of faith; and Karl and Jane Faase about their own journey of faith.

programme.title: Bible Land Passages
programme.desc: Bible Land Passages is designed help others better understand and appreciate the Bible. Read about places like Beersheba, Jericho, Jerusalem, Caesarea, and cities surrounding the Sea of Galilee, and discover that those places exist just as the Bible describes. Explore the lands of the Bible and uncover a window into the ancient past. Sift through the archaeological data, travel down the pathways of the Bible lands and traverse through the passages of its ancient cities, trade routes, and caves and understand and appreciate the challenges of life faced by Christian forbearers, and learn how God used the historical and geographic setting of the Bible lands to refine and develop their faith. Those same real places and same real settings - when examined in the modern era - can likewise become a passage for developing greater faith and devotion for God.

programme.title: Soul Sessions
programme.desc: Hosted by Sara Jane Elika Soul Sessions is an exploration into the New Zealand gospel music scene with a focus on Pacific musicians and artists. The award-winning artists are a mix of new and established faces, who share the vision of expressing their faith through music.

programme.title: Whats Cooking with Young and Free
programme.desc: Join Young and Free in the kitchen as they serve up a feast of music videos and a side of laughs.

programme.title: OK TV
programme.desc: Powerful, life filled topics are presented in an enjoyable and proven format. Hosts, Brendon and Cathie have poured their 30 years of experience with kids in schools and in ministry and the great goals of the local church into a energetic show that will engage the next generation.

programme.title: Connect
programme.desc: Connect follows a plucky school theatre group that aspires to stage every book of the Bible. The kids are pretty sure they have a clear understanding of everything that happens in Gods Big Story. Well...most of it. They do have a few questions, concerns, and outright misconceptions. Fortunately, an ever-expanding cast of surprising and often bizarre visitors is on hand to help them navigate their journey through the scriptures. And yes, there is a talking sock.

programme.title: TV One Life
programme.desc: TV One Life is the kind of show that will keep you watching. Its a commercial spoof one minute, a reality segment the next and heartfelt ministry after that. Between the humour, music and unfiltered ministry, the message is clear, "God can change your life"! Fasten your seatbelts for this roller coaster ride of a show!

programme.title: Katherine Ruonala Ministries
programme.desc: Katherine Ruonala shares a practical message of love and hope to the nations. Reaching across denominational walls, her ministry is used to spread the fires of revival and ignite a fresh passion in the hearts of believers to go deeper in their relationship with God. Katherine carries a strong prophetic and miracle anointing with many experiencing instant healing in her meetings.

programme.title: A Very Tall Man
programme.desc: Gary Hoogvliet, a very tall man, interviews interesting folk, not quite as tall as he, but nevertheless with fascinating and inspiring stories to tell.

programme.title: Be That
programme.desc: Ironically, in this era of Social Media, people are feeling more isolated and disconnected than ever. Groups like the team at Be That are looking to change this, encouraging Australians to connect face to face and begin real conversations. Be That has assembled a crew of Clinical Psychologists to develop relevant resources to encourage people to gather together and connect through intentional and empowering conversations. The Be That TV Show, created in partnership with ACCTV, shares the real stories of individuals, couples and families who have journeyed through bondage to freedom and inspire others that they too can overcome challenges. Topics are discussed with host Jo Bouris, and regular panellist, Clinical Psychologist, Sarah Harriott. Guests are welcomed to the couch, who speak hope, life and encouragement through their personal experience. Viewers can then access the topic resources and corresponding questions to start their own journey to understanding and healing: Be that person they were designed to be.

programme.title: When Calls the Heart
programme.desc: Elizabeth confronts an imposing figure from her past with Nathans support and Rosemary helps Lee navigate a new leadership role. Meanwhile, Lucas struggles to find bidders for his resort project.

programme.title: HumanKind
programme.desc: At New Hope Care in Brisbane, Emma Broadley is redefining the concept of family. By creating a welcoming space for those who often feel invisible, shes building a community where strangers become kin. Explore how Emmas journey of finding her own sense of belonging has blossomed into a mission to offer that same gift to others.

programme.title: The Kindness Diaries
programme.desc: Adventurer Leon Logothetis travels from Alaska to Argentina relying on the kindness of strangers and surprising unsuspecting good Samaritans with life-changing gifts!

programme.title: The Kindness Diaries
programme.desc: Adventurer Leon Logothetis travels from Alaska to Argentina relying on the kindness of strangers and surprising unsuspecting good Samaritans with life-changing gifts!

programme.title: A Fantail Journey
programme.desc: This series showcases a variety of uniquely Christian Kiwi content produced at Fantail Studios. Jared shares his heart behind them and the call that God has for each of us in sharing testimonies and to seek His Kingdom.

programme.title: Billy Graham Classics
programme.desc: The best-known Christian evangelist of the 20th century, Billy Graham gained world attention in 1949 with a tent revival in downtown Los Angeles that was scheduled for three weeks and lasted six. In the ensuing 55 years and more, Billy Graham Crusades consistently drew audiences of thousands to arenas and stadiums throughout the world.Classic Crusades presents the best of the last 35 years of Billy Graham that brought the message of salvation through Jesus Christ to the world. World renowned actors, singers, athletes and ministers share the platform with Dr. Graham. Also often features the famous sounds of the Billy Graham Choir, George Beverly Shea and Cliff Barrows for an hour of blessing and inspiration to all who watch.

programme.title: New Creation Church
programme.sub-title: Powerful Keys To Unlocking Gods Word Pt 4 of 4
programme.desc: Pastor Joseph Prince preaches dynamic messages centred on the pure gospel of the grace of God. His desire is to help believers understand grace and how greatly blessed, highly favoured and deeply loved they are by their heavenly Father.

programme.title: In Touch
programme.sub-title: The Promise To Heal/A Life of Service
programme.desc: The In Touch program reaches the world with the Gospel with messages that tackle such issues as parenting, finances, personal crises, emotions, and relationships. Dr. Stanley fervently believes the Bible to be the inerrant Word of God, a belief strongly reflected in his teaching. Dr Charles Stanley is the author of more than 50 books.

programme.title: Joyce Meyer: Enjoying Everyday Life
programme.desc: With her no nonsense preaching Joyce Meyer shares practical teaching about living life as a Christian. In an encouraging and supportive way, hear real stories that will challenge you to be the best that you can be. Joyce Meyer is one of the worlds leading practical Bible teachers. A New York Times bestselling author, her books have helped millions of people find hope and restoration through Jesus Christ. In this series you will see her powerful preaching from her home church, as well as the crusades around the world, and intriguing interviews with a variety of guests. Be inspired and encouraged this week, with Joyce Meyer on Enjoying Everyday Life.

programme.title: When Calls the Heart
programme.desc: Elizabeth confronts an imposing figure from her past with Nathans support and Rosemary helps Lee navigate a new leadership role. Meanwhile, Lucas struggles to find bidders for his resort project.

programme.title: The Wedding Veil Legacy
programme.desc: Though happy for her newlywed best friends, Tracy is still skeptical of the wedding veils legend - especially when her longtime relationship ends after her boyfriend wants her to leave her beloved New York City for his new dream job in Los Angeles. While at the tailor to have repairs made to the veil, Tracy meets Nick (Webster). Later, they serendipitously run in to each other at Nicks family restaurant and Tracy agrees to hire him to cater the upcoming 25th anniversary gala of the auction house where she works. As Tracy spends more time with Nick, she realises shes falling for him but isnt quite ready yet. Is it possible that the veil is losing its magic and wont lead Tracy to her true love?

programme.title: Bible Land Passages
programme.sub-title: Shiloh - The Place where God Once Dwelt
programme.desc: Bible Land Passages is designed help others better understand and appreciate the Bible. Read about places like Beersheba, Jericho, Jerusalem, Caesarea, and cities surrounding the Sea of Galilee, and discover that those places exist just as the Bible describes. Explore the lands of the Bible and uncover a window into the ancient past. Sift through the archaeological data, travel down the pathways of the Bible lands and traverse through the passages of its ancient cities, trade routes, and caves and understand and appreciate the challenges of life faced by Christian forbearers, and learn how God used the historical and geographic setting of the Bible lands to refine and develop their faith. Those same real places and same real settings - when examined in the modern era - can likewise become a passage for developing greater faith and devotion for God.

programme.title: Hour of Power
programme.desc: Since 1970 the Hour of Power has been reaching viewers from around the world. Originally founded by Dr Robert H Schuller, the program became the most-watched religious program in the world, reaching 17 million viewers. Now under the leadership of Bobby Schuller, Dr Schullers grandson. The congregation worships at Shepherds Grove Church in Garden Grove, CA. The program aims to provide spiritual principles and practices that can help people, as they become happy students of Jesus and live a life of meaning. To learn more about who they are in Christ through the process of formation, to belong to his family of believers and become a part of the community and to heal as they are loved and then love and help heal others through mission. Jesus Christ ushered in the Kingdom of God into our world through His death and resurrection. He invites everyone to be a part of this amazing movement by trusting and following Him. There is no fuller, richer life than the one that is lived in Christ.

programme.title: Impact for Life
programme.desc: An inspirational program with principles for living, and life stories from everyday New Zealanders. Collated with a fresh and dynamic edge, Pastors Peter and Bev Mortlock share principles both from the platform, and on location. Impact for Life equips people to mature and grow into Christ-likeness while maximising their potential.

programme.title: Answers with Bayless Conley
programme.sub-title: Why Haven_t My Prayers Been Answered? Part 1
programme.desc: It is one of lifes pressing questions: Why do prayers sometimes seem to go unanswered? Pastor Bayless begins to unpack the answer in part one of his message, Why Havent My Prayers Been Answered? Dive in and discover what the different types of prayer are, and why it is important to pray with holy hands, free from unresolved anger, doubt, and bitterness. Discover how you can unlock the power of persistent, faith-filled prayer in this encouraging message!

programme.title: PowerPoint with Jack Graham
programme.desc: PowerPoint Ministries started as a vision of Dr Jack Graham and his wife, Deb, 20 years ago. They believed that the power of God was evident in their growing church and that His Gospel message should be spread beyond the walls of that church to the world at large. They put their faith into action and purchased airtime on the Trinity Broadcasting Network. PowerPoint Ministries was then officially launched in April 1994. Over the past 19 years, PowerPoint Ministries has grown to an expansive network of local, national, and international television and radio broadcasts. In fact, PowerPoint can be seen or heard by a potential audience of millions of television viewers and radio listeners across the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, South Africa, Iran, Russia, Israel and more. The Ministry has a vision to glorify God by introducing Jesus Christ as Lord to as many people as possible and to develop them in Christian living using the most effective means to impact the world, making an eternal difference in this generation.

programme.title: The Catholic Guy
programme.desc: Bruce Downes is The Catholic Guy. Bruce and his team will move, inspire and challenge you to live your life to the absolute fullest. No matter your age, situation or background, be prepared to laugh, learn and listen to what God is trying to say to you. Bruce travels Australia speaking regularly about his experiences in life and in the Church in a way that is both relatable and easy to understand. Bruces message of power, impact, freedom and purpose is for anyone and everyone - for no matter where you are around the world today, God is never far from you.

programme.title: New Creation Church
programme.sub-title: Powerful Keys To Unlocking Gods Word Pt 4 of 4
programme.desc: Pastor Joseph Prince preaches dynamic messages centred on the pure gospel of the grace of God. His desire is to help believers understand grace and how greatly blessed, highly favoured and deeply loved they are by their heavenly Father.

programme.title: Veggie Tales
programme.desc: The Israelites are trying to get to the promised land, but first they must pass through Jericho, which is guarded by the French Peas! Also, some of Joshuas charges have their own ideas on how to get past the walled city. Will Joshua listen to Gods directions, or will he try to do things his way?

programme.title: Deditos
programme.desc: This quirky kids show introduces children to classic stories from the Old Testament using finger puppets.

programme.title: New Horizons
programme.sub-title: Life Hacks: Pocket tips from the Book of Proverbs Pt4
programme.desc: In this new series, Marc Rader, Senior Pastor of Gymea Baptist Church, explores the wisdom of the Book of Proverbs. "Proverbs is one of the most intensely practical and ignored parts of scripture," Marc said. "This series will look at the wisdom that God has built into the created order, so that we can observe it and put it into practice in our day to day lives." Join us for this inspiring series.

programme.title: Soul Sessions
programme.desc: Hosted by Sara Jane Elika Soul Sessions is an exploration into the New Zealand gospel music scene with a focus on Pacific musicians and artists. The award-winning artists are a mix of new and established faces, who share the vision of expressing their faith through music.

programme.title: Jeni: Seeking the Extraordinary
programme.desc: Jeni is back on the road, visiting the amazing state of Oregon in the USA. Close friend, Casey Cole, joins her in this exciting series. Together, they go fly fishing, crabbing, white water rafting, and zip lining. During their adventure, Jeni and Casey take you to the picturesque Cannon Beach and experience the fun of an exciting rodeo. Lots of laughter and adventure, times of sharing their hearts about spiritual matters, and plenty of the extraordinary.

programme.title: Be That
programme.desc: Its challenging enough to combine two people into one relationship, but adding the ingredient of kids can make a recipe for relationship stress! Blended and step families make up around 1 in 10 families. They face unique challenges that often lead to conflict, but with a little patience and a lot of love, a blended family can also experience a strength thats only found at the other side of great challenge. Steven shares about his experience of entering a relationship with Rachel, when she already had three kids. To navigate the challenges, they had to be intentional and communicate clearly through every step.

programme.title: Elevation Experience
programme.desc: The Elevation Experience with Pastor Steven Furtick features inspirational and challenging messages from Pastor Steven as well as original worship music from Elevation Church in Charlotte, North Carolina.

programme.title: Life with Paul De Jong
programme.desc: We like to call it soul food. LIFE TV uses creative illustration, real life stories and biblical teaching to encourage and help viewers discover a greater purpose to their lives.

programme.title: Drive Thru History
programme.desc: In this series of Drive Thru History, Dave Stotts explores the amazing lives of the very first Christians. Beginning in Jerusalem and using the Book of Acts as a roadmap, Dave travels the Mediterranean region to share the people, places, and events that launched the Christian faith. He investigates what happened after the Gospel accounts of Jesus Christ. Dave follows the lives of the disciples through Israel, and travels the missionary routes of Paul and his companions. We finish with John on the island of Patmos, and drive through the seven churches of Revelation in Asia Minor.

programme.title: Joyce Meyer: Enjoying Everyday Life

programme.title: Convocation
programme.desc: Convocation at Liberty University is North Americas largest weekly gathering of Christian students, and each year it plays host to more than 80 guest speakers of national significance from every sphere of society. The services, held within the Vines Centre at the University during each semester, connect students with their Creator through passionate worship and powerful messages firmly rooted in Biblical truth.

programme.title: Welcome to Hope
programme.desc: John reclaims his life and welcomes a new beginning, while Jake leans on friends and family to help with May.

programme.title: Behind the Sash
programme.desc: In this special episode we dig deeper into the four leading ladies adversities and follow their journey to visit Sydney golden girl Ally Pinnock. As the ladies sail the Sydney Harbour they learn of her own rise through adversity and ability to use creative arts to heal.

programme.title: Owlegories
programme.desc: Owlegories is an animated series that follows a group of student owls as they travel on adventures learning about nature, faith, and God! You can tell a lot about an artist by what he creates. That is the theme behind Owlegories. Owlegories teaches kids about God through the amazing things found in nature and revealed in Gods word. The banner verse for Owlegories is Psalm 19:1-4: "The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands. Day after day they pour forth speech; night after night they reveal knowledge. They have no speech, they use no words; no sound is heard from them. Yet their voice goes out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world."

programme.title: Food Safari Water
programme.desc: Maeve explores how preserving fish creates whole new worlds of flavour in smoked salmon, bottarga, and XO sauce.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Cake Week! 12 of Australias best amateur bakers are back in the Bake Off shed for their first week of challenges, under the watchful eyes of culinary icon Maggie Beer, and esteemed chef Matt Moran. This week, the bakers will tackle a signature sponge, a tricky technical Japanese Cotton Cheesecake, and for their showstopper, create their own Miniature Worlds. One will be crowned the weeks Star Baker, and one will head home.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Spice Week, which means a bitter end for at least one of the remaining bakers. Paul and Prue will be turning up the heat with a classic teatime favourite signature. Theres a technical challenge thats one of the toughest of the series so far, as we test the bakers on a tricky Arabian pastry. And, finally, a fiddly showstopper that promises to be anything but light work. Three challenges. Three chances to win star baker. Three chances to avoid leaving the tent.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness and Cherry Healey hit factory floors across Britain for a snoop around their supersized production lines to reveal what the secrets are behind supermarket staples.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Reporters travel around the world to find out what goes into the food that people buy.

programme.title: Ginos Italian Express
programme.desc: The last episode of the series sees Gino taking a railway adventure to picturesque Lake Iseo. Often overshadowed by its big sisters, Garda and Como, Lake Iseo is a real hidden gem. After getting the train from Bergamo, Gino starts his day out on the lake fishing for sardines, surrounded by the beautiful mountains. He takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for passengers on a very special train- Treno dei Sapore. This is a tourist train, taking guests along the lake side and into the Franciacorta region and whilst they enjoy the views, they also get a 7 course meal, with todays starter cooked by Gino. Next, Gino swaps the train for a handcrafted boat, made by Master Craftsman Andrea, who takes him across the lake to Monte Isola, the biggest lake island in Europe. Here, Gino meets the islands Mayor and finds out what life is like on Monte Isola, before making poached pears in red wine and vanilla.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook all their courses celebrating the Olympics and Paralympics as the judges are joined by a legendary British hurdler to choose the Welsh regional winner.

programme.title: Tom Kerridges Sunday Lunch
programme.desc: Tom transforms his favourite Chinese dishes into a delicious Sunday feast. First up, he makes aromatic crispy duck served with pancakes and homemade plum sauce.

programme.title: Jamies Quick and Easy Food
programme.desc: With four mouth watering recipes in each show, Jamie kicks things off this week by cooking up his Crazy Good Pork Burger, a naughty little treat that takes fast food to the next level. Then its Sticky Mango Prawns, a speedy sharing platter with a shortcut to phenomenal flavour; and Easy Rustic Gnocchi, an elegant veggie supper made with a super-quick sauce. And finally, Frozen Banoffee Cheesecake, a party show stopper thats irresistibly simple to make. If you think you havent got time to cook, think again.

programme.title: Mary Berrys Love To Cook
programme.desc: The more the merrier is a motto Mary Berry lives by. What is better than cooking crowd-pleasing delights and meeting others who also adore feeding the masses?

programme.title: Eat Well For Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris are in Bromley with a family bored of the same old meals, to get them all to play their part in the kitchen.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Spice Week, which means a bitter end for at least one of the remaining bakers. Paul and Prue will be turning up the heat with a classic teatime favourite signature. Theres a technical challenge thats one of the toughest of the series so far, as we test the bakers on a tricky Arabian pastry. And, finally, a fiddly showstopper that promises to be anything but light work. Three challenges. Three chances to win star baker. Three chances to avoid leaving the tent.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Cooking For Less Special
programme.desc: Jamie shares recipe ideas that can be made for less than 1 pound. With principles that can be used in the kitchen as well as practical tips to adapt to whatever ingredients are available.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsays Next Level Chef
programme.desc: The remaining chefs butcher and break down various cuts of beef amongst their teams to create sizzling steak dishes; two contestants face elimination as they enter a heated seafood cook-off.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino And Freds Road Trip
programme.desc: The next stop is Galicia in north-west Spain, where Gordon gets in touch with his Celtic roots. They catch clams in Cambados and taste an incredible local delicacy: goose barnacles.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook all their courses celebrating the Olympics and Paralympics as the judges are joined by a legendary British hurdler to choose the Welsh regional winner.

programme.title: Tom Kerridges Sunday Lunch

programme.title: Tropical Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: Justine finds exotic local ingredients like Inyam, Taro and river prawns for todays recipes. The prawns are pan fried with shallots and butter while the Inyam goes into a rich, slow cooked Octopus stew.

programme.title: MasterChef UK: Celebrity
programme.desc: Its the Celebrity MasterChef 2024 Final! The final three celebrities face off with an Ultimate Dinner Party Menu. With creativity and taste on the line, John and Gregg will crown the champion.

programme.title: Food Safari Water
programme.desc: Maeve explores how preserving fish creates whole new worlds of flavour in smoked salmon, bottarga, and XO sauce.

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.sub-title: Mont Blancs, A Chocolate Amenity, Trifle Towering Sculptures
programme.desc: Six new teams make Mont Blancs and a chocolate amenity, without any recipes to follow, before transforming the classic trifle into a fine-dining showpiece with towering sculptures.

programme.title: The Great Kiwi Bake Off
programme.desc: This week on the Great Kiwi Bake Off, Bread Week brings high expectations as Deans expertise weighs on the Bakers minds. The first bake requires everyone make a 30cm Pizza, and Sue is desperate for the bakers to use traditional and complementary flavours, which is not what Louise is doing, as she prepares her Cheeseburger pizza without seasoning her meat patties.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: North West England: Starters And Fish
programme.desc: Four chefs compete for the North West with canapes, starters and fish dishes inspired by the Olympics and Paralympics. Who will be eliminated?

programme.title: Eat Well For Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris wean a Scottish family off takeaways, reduce their waste and get them cooking meals everyone can enjoy.

programme.title: Tropical Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: Justine shows us a simple yet flavour filled way to cook local prawns. Feast your eyes on a seriously luxurious venison and foie gras burger before Justine demonstrates a lighter use for beef.

programme.title: Mary Berrys Love To Cook
programme.desc: Mary steps out with daughter Annabel, who shares her joy of foraging and cooking in the open, while rustling up her best recipes that offer the perfect comfort for family and friends.

programme.title: Jamies Quick and Easy Food

programme.title: Farm to Fork
programme.desc: Andy teams up with guest chef Lynn to whip up a refreshing Crunchy Beef Salad. Michael crafts a delectable Three Herb and Prawn Rice Paper Rolls served with a delectable Peanut Dipping Sauce.

programme.title: MasterChef UK: The Professionals
programme.desc: MasterChef: The Professionals is back on BBC One for its 15th series, as 32 ambitious chefs from across the country battle to become the 2022 Champion. Presiding over the UKs most revered cooking competition, are new judge and acclaimed chef Anna Haugh, Michelin-starred chef Marcus Wareing and celebrated MasterChef judge, Gregg Wallace, all eager to discover a brand new culinary star. Over six weeks, the 32 professional chefs will have their skills, creativity and culinary knowledge put to the test in a series of demanding challenges as the judges hunt out the most impressive talent in the industry. Only the best will be in with a chance of winning the coveted MasterChef: The Professionals trophy.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: In Biscuit Week, our remaining amateur bakers face off in three exciting biscuit challenges- a signature slice-and-bake, an Alfajores technical, and for the showstopper, will create a magical hanging biscuit chandelier, judged by culinary icon Maggie Beer and renowned chef Matt Moran. One will be crowned the weeks Star Baker, and one will be sent home.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Pastry Week, and with just seven bakers left, Paul and Prue are looking for perfection. For the signature challenge, its samosa time, with a sweet and a savoury option to really test the bakers. Theres a classic French technical involving two types of pastry and an ambitious final challenge, as the bakers are pushed to the edge with a majestic pie fit for a banquet. Its past the half way point in the competition, and the remaining bakers are starting to believe that they could win. Who will win the coveted star baker title and who will leave the Bake Off tent?

programme.desc: The five best teams from last week tackle mini celebration cakes and a patisserie classic, the Les Miserables, before creating a grand piece montee with two flavours of choux buns.

programme.desc: Its International week and the bakers arrive to their first signature bake, twelve Cornish pasties. Dean is looking for innovative flavours and accuracy when it comes to the technicalities, and Sue refuses to look past any mistakes when it comes to baking time.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: North West England: Mains And Dessert
programme.desc: The three remaining North West chefs cook their mains and desserts, celebrating the Olympics and Paralympics. Theres stress, disasters and victory, as only two can make it through.

programme.title: Eat Well For Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help a Cardiff family living with food allergies try new products and meals they can all eat.

programme.title: Tropical Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: Today a whole coral trout is going on the barbecue as Justine prepares lunch by the waters edge. Then Jerome from the Meridian elevates chicken and vegetables to a fine dining standard.

programme.title: Mary Berrys Love To Cook
programme.desc: Dame Mary Berry loves to encourage people to get in the kitchen and cook, with delicious recipes that even the most inexperienced cooks can master and the experienced cooks love.

programme.title: Jamies Quick and Easy Food
programme.desc: With four mouth watering recipes packed into each show, this week Jamie starts by cooking up his tasty Tikka Chicken - its the quickest roast youll ever make. And if that wasnt enough, Jamies Chocolate Orange Shortbread takes the humble biscuit to a brand new level. If you think you havent got time to cook, think again.

programme.title: Farm to Fork
programme.desc: Michael and Andy cook up a tantalising dish of Asparagus and Mushroom noodles with Mushroom XO Sauce. Andy impresses with his barbecue squid featuring romesco, parsley, and preserved lemon.

programme.title: MasterChef UK: The Professionals
programme.desc: MasterChef: The Professionals is back on BBC One for its 15th series, as 32 ambitious chefs from across the country battle to become the 2022 Champion. Presiding over the UKs most revered cooking competition, are new judge and acclaimed chef Anna Haugh, Michelin-starred chef Marcus Wareing and celebrated MasterChef judge, Gregg Wallace, all eager to discover a brand new culinary star. Over six weeks, the 32 professional chefs will have their skills, creativity and culinary knowledge put to the test in a series of demanding challenges as the judges hunt out the most impressive talent in the industry. Only the best will be in with a chance of winning the coveted MasterChef: The Professionals trophy.

programme.title: The Great Australian Bake Off
programme.desc: In Nostalgia Week, our remaining amateur bakers deep dive into their memories to tackle a number of Aussie classics of yesteryear and invent one of their own! In signature, theyll create their own layered pavlovas, in technical will tackle a classic Maggie Beer steamed pudding, and for showstopper, will create a mashup of nostalgic Aussie flavours to invent something entirely new. Under the watchful eyes of judges Maggie Beer and Matt Moran, one will be crowned the weeks Star Baker and one will head home.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Week eight of The Great British Bake Off, and Velkommen to Danish week. Our five bakers are facing unfamiliar recipes as they battle to impress Prue, Paul AND Sandi. Theres a bread challenge signature where they must prove style and substance. Paul sets a spherical technical and with a place in the Bake Off Semi final at stake, everyone is outto impress. And for their final challenge the bakers must face an elaborate pastry showstopper that could take centre stage at a Danish birthday party. Who will become an honoury Great Dane and who will be leaving the tent?

programme.title: High Country Farm
programme.desc: Celebrity chef Nadia Lim and her family transform a Victorian farmstead in Queenstown, New Zealand, into a sustainable farm, facing challenges and cooking with fresh, seasonal ingredients.

programme.title: River Cottage: Veg
programme.desc: This episode is all about the garden. Hugh and the team revel in the first sweet roots of summer. Hugh climbs a monkey puzzle tree looking for meat-free protein. Hugh and Gill cook beetroot tarte tatin and summer salad with pearl spelt, and Tim makes broad bean bruschetta. Hugh then catches up with his smallholding pals at Bramble Farm in Bristol. And Hugh and head gardener Mark convince the local horticultural show to judge their entries on taste rather than looks, but find themselves up against a green-fingered man of the cloth.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two top chefs from the North West go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus. Bestselling author of The Gruffalo, Julia Donaldson, is guest judge and helps decide a winner.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsays Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches how to cook with confidence. Recipes include delicious pork chops with sweet and sour peppers, and pan-fried scallops with crunchy apple salad, and Gordon shares a tip for keeping your knives sharp.

programme.title: Honest Renovations
programme.desc: Koey juggles a full-time job, side hustle, and kids, so when her sister gifts her their shared home, she struggles to find time for renovations to make it her own.

programme.title: Extreme Makeover: Home Edition
programme.desc: The hosts aid a deserving family in Houston who lost their home, beloved grandmother and pet cat in a devastating fire.

programme.title: My Dream Home
programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan Scott help Sophie and Preston, who are tired of renting and need a home with more space for their fabulous parties.

programme.title: Love It or List It Vancouver
programme.desc: Harvey adores his heritage house, but his wife Susan cant stand the old-fashioned layout. Can Jillian convince Susan to stay? Or will Todd show Harvey he needs a more family-friendly home?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Former firefighter Paul, and his partner Julia cant wait to buy a holiday home on Tenerife, where they plan to spend up to half the year, once Julia also retires. Both are keen runners, having competed in marathons and triathlons, and love Costa Adeje in the south of the island for the great outdoor lifestyle it offers, so theyve asked Laura Hamilton to help find them a property there with outside space, a pool, and enough space for their family to visit.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman is house hunting around the stunning countryside and whitewashed towns and villages of Almeria, with former bus driver Sue and postwoman Ali.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman is travelling to the beautiful city of Jerez, in the south of Spain to come to the aid of house hunters, Kay and Barry. They met eight years ago in a museum and share a love of history and culture.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Penny and Jon are former detectives, who still work for the police force and now facing retirement, cant wait to buy a holiday home in Spain to spend their winters. Theyve chosen the northern Costa Almeria as their ideal location.

programme.title: Love It or List It
programme.desc: When a house no longer feels like home, owners are left with a big financial and emotional question: renovate or real estate? Hosts David and Hilary help fed-up owners decide.

programme.title: House Hunters Renovation
programme.desc: Home buyers tour for-sale homes and choose the one that is the perfect fixer-upper.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Barry and Robyn Henwood love the environment in different ways; his is a passion for green technology, while she loves turning native flora into textiles and teaching yoga. Theyre building a stylish beach shack to retire in, one that floats on a pair of untouched sand dunes in Aldinga on Adelaides southern coast. Solar-powered, and aesthetically pleasing, it should be the perfect fit, but Robyn is yet to be convinced. Her life is entrenched in the city so she needs some cajoling. The contemporary modest design features a pair of steel clad pods joined by a timber walkway, and surrounded by native bush. But as soon as building gets under way, the excavation impacts on the environment. Despite their best efforts replanting and shoring up the dunes, the beach scrub soon dwindles and Robyn and Barry are left pondering their next course of action. As the dunes progressively erode, the more Robyn and Barry persevere. But when their self-rusting steel cladding is battered by harsh coastal conditions, staining their deck and turning the exterior into something resembling dribbled fat, Robyns doubts really set in. Can they restore their precious landscape and will Robyn eventually sever her ties with the city and make her project in the dunes home?

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Heritage is a powerful thing. In the Adelaide Hills, its shaped entire towns through stone buildings, many of which were built by the first wave of German immigrants. It was this heritage that drew a couple with Italian blood - web designer Louise Sergie and psychologist husband Steve Hardwick and their three kids - to this pocket of history. They bought a block with stone outhouses and an established English garden, a mix of styles that influences their thinking about their own grand design. Being an owner/builder is stressful for the most experienced, but more so if youre new to the game. The couple are passionate about creating a stone home and want to blend a Tuscan feel with a modern look, using 160 tonnes of locally quarried stone to create castle-thick walls, recycled timbers for internal joinery, and a cutting-edge bridge linking the upstairs rooms with a dynamic glass box, will ensure that this will be a style that defies categorisation.

programme.desc: Drew and Jonathan Scott help Sophie and Preston, who are tired of renting and need a home with more space for their fabulous parties.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Sandy inherited her parents home thats been in their family for three generations. But with a closed-off layout, a kitchen thats falling apart and outdated finishes, the house needs help.

programme.title: Buying and Selling
programme.desc: Francis and Juanita bought the first house they could afford. They still love the property, but with two kids and a dream of reuniting their extended family under one roof, the house is now too small.

programme.title: Buying and Selling
programme.desc: Lesley and her son moved in with Ryan and his two boys, but the house is way too small for their blended family and they desperately need more space. Drew and Jonathan step in to kick-start the familys future.

programme.title: My Dream Home
programme.desc: Super-planner Carson has been crashing at her best friend Leahs place. But its high time she found a Nashville pad of her own. Carson knows exactly what she wants, but finding a picture-perfect property that meets her high standards could prove tricky. Drew soon learns that taking Carson out of her ideal neighbourhood is a tough sell. And its Leah who comes up with a surprising off-the-market solution. Later, Jonathan tackles an ambitious reno with Carsons extensive design binder in hand. A much-needed outdoor drain hits a roadblock, and Carsons list of add-ons goes on and on and on.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: A couple move in search of a slower pace of life and a historic Southern forever home. Ben and Erin inject their new home with a deluxe kitchen and a classic Southern porch.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous
programme.sub-title: Historic Cottage Gets A Modern Upgrade
programme.desc: High school sweethearts looking for a change from suburban life find a historic 1940s home in downtown Bentonville. Dave and Jenny transform the small home by maximising every square foot.

programme.title: House Hunters Renovation
programme.desc: Home buyers tour for-sale homes and choose the one that is the perfect fixer-upper.

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Home
programme.desc: Jodi and Mel, Drew and Jonathans best friends from college, almost gave up on owning a home. The 70s-style house desperately needs an update, but it is in a desirable neighbourhood and has solid bones.

programme.title: My Dream Home
programme.desc: With two young boys and an extended family that loves to socialise, Cori and Soroosh are desperate to buy a new house so turn to property experts Drew and Jonathan Scott for advice.

programme.desc: Karin and Bruce love their dogs and entertaining. Can Jillian turn their home into a pet-friendly oasis and convince Karin to stay? Will Todd win Bruce over with a move-in-ready house that is set up for socialising?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: When Paul asked his wife Tracey what she wanted for her 50th birthday, she replied a house, so now with the help of Danni Menzies, the couple are hunting around the villages of Lake Vinuela in southern Spain for their dream holiday home.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: The search is on in southern Spain for a holiday home for retired tugboat captain, and keen skier Geoff, who is torn between his love of the sea and the mountains.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is house hunting with Shane and Sharon around La Cala de Mijas on the Costa del Sol in southern Spain. The couple are dreaming of a holiday home close to the beach that they can escape to during the winter to enjoy the areas great, all-year round outdoor lifestyle.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King is in Spains Orihuela Costa helping Donna and Graeme find the perfect holiday home for their budget of 75,000 pounds. Theyre after a two-three bed apartment that feels light and airy.

programme.title: Love It or List It
programme.desc: When a house no longer feels like home, owners are left with a big financial and emotional question: renovate or real estate? Hosts David and Hilary help fed-up owners decide.
